to his estates and quite recovered the phil- anthropic mood in which he had left Peters- burg, and wrote enthusiastic letters to his "brother-instructor" as he called the Grand Master. 
"How easy it is, how little effort it needs, to do so much good," thought Pierre, "and how little attention we pay to itl" 
He was pleased at the gratitude he received, but felt abashed at receiving it. This gratitude reminded him of how much more he might do for these simple, kindly people.
